exhibition_title: Henri Cartier-Bresson: Pen, Brush, and Cameras
exhibition_description: This was a major retrospective exhibition that explored the career of Henri Cartier-Bresson, one of the leading photo-journalists of twentieth-century photography. The exhibition was comprised of nearly 100 drawings and photographs selected by the artist, included for the first time a representative sampling of eight rarely exhibition oil paintings and seven films by or about the artist. The exhibition toured selected museum during 1996 and 1997. A small illustrated catalogue accompanied the exhibition and included an essay by a leading Cartier-Bresson scholar.
